description:
What You'll Do:

  • Drafting and preparing pleadings and other work products
  • Working with our proprietary software online portal to review generative AI outputs and work product drafts
  • Helping craft drafting, review, and editing processes for pleadings and other work products
  • Editing and reviewing draft work products
  • Testing out the latest versions of generative AI platforms for drafting and preparing pleadings and other work products

What You’ll Need:

  • Bachelor’s or higher degree
  • Juris Doctor (JD) degree from an accredited law school
  • Admission to CA bar and in good standing
  • Additional bar admissions including NY, FL, NV, etc. are a bonus
  • At least 5-10 years of experience in CA civil litigation, preferably with experience in both plaintiff-side employment and personal injury practice
  • Extensive experience with drafting and preparing pleadings, motions, and other legal documents, discovery in the civil litigation context, oral advocacy and appearing in Court, motion practice, and taking/defending depositions
  • Strong background in various types of employment cases including: discrimination, wrongful termination, wage and hour, retaliation, PAGA, breach of contract, and sexual harassment litigation
  • Strong background in various types of personal injury cases including: auto, slip & fall, motorcycle, wrongful death, medical malpractice, premises liability, product liability, insurance disputes, TBI, and catastrophic injury
    • Exposure to medical defects, mass torts, etc. is a bonus
  • Arbitration and trial experience strongly preferred
  • Litigation experience in state and federal court
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with clients and team members.
  • Strong work ethic, professionalism and positive attitude
  • Attention to detail and strong analytical skills
  • Exposure to generative AI tools and platforms, preferably experience using these tools for drafting, proofreading, legal research, etc. (knowledge of foundation models is a bonus)
  • Experience with case management software and e-discovery platforms highly preferred (Clio, Filevine, Smokeball, Relativity, Disco, Everlaw, etc.)
